revised_title: JASIN: Exploring the Structure of the Turbulent Atmospheric Boundary Layer
tldr: The Joint Air-Sea Interaction Project (JASIN) investigated the structure of the turbulent atmospheric boundary layer. By using multiple instruments on aircraft and tethered balloons, researchers collected data on mean flow and turbulent fluctuations. The study found that continuous small-scale turbulent mixing was generally confined to an Ekman layer a few hundred meters deep, with direct coupling between the Ekman layer and the overlying atmosphere being weak and dependent on cloud processes.
